question: Well, if it isn't the little Frenchman! How is the little Frenchman?
answer: Fine!

question: You don't mind if I go instead, do you?
answer: No...

question: It is. It's a coin! I'll get it for you, Father! Padre? You shouldn't dive everyday, Papa.
answer: Then you shouldn't eat everyday, Jacques. Hey! Have you ever seen a mermaid?

question: No.
answer: I've seen them. Don't you want to know where? Why don't you ask me?

question: What?
answer: Where I saw the mermaids?! Why don't you ever ask any question? I'm always the one asking the question! We're sitting here like two stones and I'm taking to myself. Ask me something, Goddamnit!

question: Why did my mother leave?
answer: Come on now, pump! Your mother didn't leave. She went back to America, that's all. It's her home. She's allergic to this Island. She likes refrigerators and machines that clean the floor... so one day she left. Woman are like that, unpredictable, like the sea.

question: So where did you see mermaids?
answer: In the bars in Athens!

question: How did it happen?
answer: The company asked me to extract everything I could from the wreck; so the divers were trying to get at the engine... and then the boat turned over... in the current... and... look, I fucked up! Can you help?

question: How many are, down there?
answer: Just one... We're feeding him air, but he's not breathing regularly... You've got to get him out fast.

question: Ten thousand.
answer: Lira?

question: Dollars.
answer: You're going to hold me up at a time like this?

question: Dollars, Roberto! We took him for ten thousand dollars!
answer: Enzo, what are you going to do with the money?

question: Have the car painted.
answer: Santini will do that for 25 dollars!

question: Then tell him to wax it too.
answer: Enzo, really. What are you going to get?

question: A rosary for Mama, a dress for Angelica, something with rhine- stones for what's her name, and get yourself a suit that fits... But most important...
answer: Yes?

question: Is this the Lago del Demonio? ... Huacracocha? Gracias.
answer: Welcome to Peru!

question: Don't you have a heater?
answer: Yeah... Sure... Is this your first trip to Peru?

question: Does anybody live to make a second? Forget about the heater!
answer: A drink to warm up?

question: Yes, thank you. Intravenous if possible.
answer: Tea... or whiskey?

question: ... both. Did I just see a man in a red suit and goggles?
answer: ... right. Dr. Lawrence? The insurance man... uh... The insurance person is here!

question: The guy in the Halloween suit!
answer: Did you have a nice trip? We were getting restless, it's been three weeks since the accident. You should get things moving, you know. We're out of equipment and we can't do half of our experiments...! Frank, check the program!

question: Who... Who is that?
answer: Mayol... Jacques Mayol.

question: That's the experiment? Dumping a guy into a frozen lake?
answer: ... The truck fell into a very deep crevasse. We weren't able to save the equipment.

question: I'll have to talk to the driver.
answer: In the spring when he melts!

question: You really send him under the ice? He isn't a slave or a convict or anything?
answer: My dear, science is a cruel mistress.

question: But... how is he going to breathe?
answer: He isn't going to breathe. Listen... That's his heartbeat. Can you hear the speed at which it's slowing down, it's incredible. He's in the fluoroscope now. Listen to his heart. Impressive, huh? The flow of blood is concentrated in the brain and doesn't even feed the limbs anymore. It's a phenomena that has only been observed with dolphins... until now.

question: How long can he stay down? Without breathing?
answer: It depends. He should come up soon. Unless he's decided to stay for the night.

question: Why is he doing this?
answer: For one thing, it's his job... as for the rest of it, I wish I knew.

question: Shouldn't somebody take him a blanket or something?
answer: Coffee might be nice.

question: Will he understand Spanish?
answer: His mother's an American. He spent half of his life in the states. I'd try English if I were you.

question: I recognize you.
answer: We saw each other a little while ago.

question: In the lake?
answer: No... in the hut.

question: I changed the lock you son of a bitch!
answer: ... Sally?

question: You're back! Hello. We were burgled.
answer: Again?

question: They got the new T.V. ... And the new stereo.
answer: I hope they remembered to take the microwave this time?

question: Yep. How was your trip...? Help me clean up, okay?
answer: You called the police?

question: They're going to send detectives. When they get around to it.
answer: So what, all they ever want is your phone number anyway.

question: Well?
answer: What?

question: How was your trip?
answer: Nice... Very interesting... Great! ... I guess.

question: Okay... Who'd you meet? A cardiogram...? You met a doctor! Congratulations, you're in the chips... Unless they have socialized medicine in Peru. Do they?
answer: It's his heartbeat.

question: Oh Jesus...! I'll make some coffee. They left the stove.
answer: 6'3", 6'1", maybe 5'9" -- You can't be sure, you know the flippers, they add height or they take it away, or something. Anyway short dark hair... Not punk or anything, just short. And the cutest smile. He wasn't smiling at me, I don't think -- just smiling. And he thought he saw me in the lake. I mean that was a figure of speech... They're so romantic, the French.

question: I thought you said he was Peruvian?
answer: Haven't you been listening?

question: ... Since eight o'clock last night...! You're in love.
answer: Don't be a jerk. There's no such thing as love at first sight.

question: Jacques, my friend, how are you?
answer: Enzo...

question: I leave you swimming and twenty years later, you're still in the water! What the hell are you doing? Training?
answer: Yes.

question: That's good. You never would have recognized me, huh? Check out the suit! Looking good, no? You know I'm the world champion?
answer: Yes, I know.

question: I dove 315 feet!
answer: Great!

question: They say I'm like Lazarus. You know, the guy who was raised from the dead?! Doesn't it surprise you that I just show up like this... Listen, the world championship starts in ten days in Taormina. Be my guest. Your ticket.
answer: Why?

question: Because I'm sure you're dying to beat me.
answer: I don't want to be in any competition... I dive because I like to, not to beat a record... don't you have to be very mad at somebody to want to beat him?

question: No. All you need is to want to be the best.
answer: You're the best, Enzo!

question: This is good work... unfortunately it's incomplete. Could you eat a sandwich 40 floors above the street.
answer: What kind?

question: Johana, am I boring you?
answer: Sorry. Of course not, definitely not... well, maybe a little. What did you say?

question: I said that the file is incomplete. See if you can get through to this Lawrence character and have him send the Peruvian registration for his missing truck... and don't let him tell you it was in the glove compartment.
answer: Right Chief!

question: Did the driver really freeze?
answer: Like a popsicle. They're keeping him on a stick until spring.

question: My God! I'm glad I didn't go.
answer: ... So am I.

question: ... So am I.
answer: ... I said, all the truck papers are in the glove compartment!

question: Okay, listen, just get the custom's office to send me a copy as fast as possible. We can't send you new equipment until our file is complete. Okay?
answer: Okay, okay. You'll have it by the end of the week, how's that?

question: You've made me a happy insurance person.
answer: Then, goodbye.

question: Wait! Professor...?
answer: ... Yes?

question: You don't know how I could reach that diver of yours... Mayol... We need some additional information... I mean, we have a few questions to ask him.
answer: The last thing I heard, he was off to Taormina for the world diving championships. That's Taormina, in Sicily!

question: Listen, I just found out we've got real problems in Sicily!
answer: What d'you mean?

question: The mafia! La Cosa Nostra! Coppola! De Niro...! I knew it! I knew we shouldn't have written that policy!!
answer: What's happened??

question: The documents are forged.
answer: No!

question: Yes! The notary is a phony. He has the same signature as the contractor!
answer: It can't be true!

question: We have to send somebody over there immediately! If we prove the forgery we can cancel the policy. We'll be off the hook. There's a flight to Rome in two hours and from there its just a short hop to Sicily.
answer: I'll send Cardoza, he'll be able to...

question: I tried him, he can't go. His son is being Bar Mitzvohed tomorrow... I'll go, boss.
answer: I thought it was Spanish that you spoke?

question: ... Are you sure? This is the hotel San Domenico? Yes, but... So, you haven't got a room left? Ah?!
answer: Be careful with that car, it's a new paint job. Giacomino! My friend! My brother! So you finally decided to join us? You did the right thing! Hey Paolo! Come stai? Get my key! You remember my little brother Roberto?

question: I remember. Hi Roberto!
answer: What room have you got?

question: I don't have one.
answer: You don't have a room? Paolo? What did I just hear? I personally called you to reserve a room for my good friend Jacques Mayol and you treat him like a stranger?!

question: It's okay, Enzo. I'll go somewhere else.
answer: Not only is Jacques Mayol a very special friend, but he happens to be one of the best divers in the world! And you're throwing him out! Are you crazy, or what? Stupido!

question: Enzo drop it, I'll find something.
answer: Take mine. I'll take the Countess' suite. She told me she was leaving for the cemetery... She'll be more comfortable there. I'm glad you're here. "Spaghetti del mare" It's delicious here. It's the one thing they really know how to make.

question: Yes, sure, for two.
answer: And a bottle of "Frascatti". Two bottles! He moves just like a woman. It must be hard to live in two worlds like that, huh? To breathe in one, swim in the other... Anyway! Nothing beats a sexy broad! Huh, Jacques! ... So, after all these years, you must have lots of questions to ask. Am I right?

question: Yes, of course. Lots of questions.
answer: Well, what are they?

question: I'm sorry... I don't know how to ask the questions.
answer: Well, then. I'll do the asking for you. "Tell me dear Enzo, how did you become World Champion?" Oh, that's a long story. Well, after you left Amorgos, I went back to Italy and joined the Navy. So you now have in front of you -- Captain Molinari, who's been on leave of absence for the past 14 years...

question: That's good.
answer: How do you make a living? Your experiments, does it pay well?

question: It's okay.
answer: ... You married?

question: No.
answer: Me neither, 'cause of my Mother. She's a curse, my Mamma, a tornado. Stubborn as a mule! I was engaged... for a week. After that, Mamma was so mad, I tell you, pasta was bouncing off the walls. So, not married. Well, good for you. You play the field, like me. A girl in every port, huh?

question: Exactly, I mean, after all, we're men!
answer: Damn right! That's what I tell them when people say you've turned into a fish.

question: People say that?
answer: Forget it. I was joking. Eh! La Madonna! This one is for me. I'll bet you my watch that she's in my bed tonight. I tell you she's mine!

question: Forget it. I was joking. Eh! La Madonna! This one is for me. I'll bet you my watch that she's in my bed tonight. I tell you she's mine!
answer: Hello!

question: You know each other?
answer: Yes.

question: Enzo Molinari. This is a great pleasure.
answer: Johana Cross, pleased to meet you. Well! Isn't this a coincidence. I really wasn't expecting this... All the way out here. It's incredible!

question: ... Okay. I'll try.
answer: Where did you two meet?

question: In a lake.
answer: I might have known. As I was telling you earlier, I'm the world champion free diver.

question: Congratulations.
answer: Some people say it's the most virile sport in the world. One has to admit that when you see those men diving head first in that deep blue sea, all muscles contracted in one super human effort...

question: Some people say it's the most virile sport in the world. One has to admit that when you see those men diving head first in that deep blue sea, all muscles contracted in one super human effort...
answer: Enzo?

question: What?
answer: Your mother?

question: Ahi, ahi, cazzo! Ma mamia! Where...? God, she'll kill me... ... if she catches me eating pasta in a restaurant. ... Mamma!
answer: You expect me to carry all the luggage myself?

question: Mamma. Roberto and an elevator... Isn't that enough?
answer: What have you been eating?

question: Thanks for helping with the bag. It looks great!
answer: I thought it was a nice place. Isn't it?

question: I'm being a pain in the ass. It's beautiful here. You're going to be very busy these days aren't you?
answer: I don't know... why?

question: Just because... I would have liked to visit the town... See the coast... I don't know anybody... Expect for you. But you are going to be very busy. You must have tons of things to prepare, interviews... And a competition like this one must require a great deal of concentration, right?
answer: Yes... Maybe... I don't know. I don't like competitions... It ruins the fun. Don't you think?

question: I guess... But you know... I'm American and I've mostly been taught to be competitive... There's always pleasure of being the best?
answer: Maybe on earth there is one... but not when you dive... You see, to dive deep into the sea, for no reason... just to do it. It's a feeling... I don't know how to say this... Voluptuous?

question: I thought you'd be at the dinner.
answer: It's too loud for me.

question: You look adorable.
answer: Thank you...

question: A one day hero! A new world record! That's great! It gives me something to beat tomorrow! You ever been to Tahiti?
answer: No.

question: I'll take you there. We'll live in the sun. You'll cook fresh fish and we'll make love under the coconut trees.
answer: You forgot the Hula!

question: Yes, of course, I'll do the Hula!
answer: You'll be lovely, but no thanks. Jacques, would you do a native dance for me?

question: He looks strange, doesn't he? Like a baby that just learned to walk.
answer: Have you known him long?

question: Forever. We used to live on the same island in Greece, when we were kids.
answer: What was he like, when he was little?

question: Little. Very little. And skinny, very skinny too. That is compared to me.
answer: I get it, Enzo you were a superior child.

question: Exactly! What is it Johana? You're so crazy about him, you don't see the truth?! Forget it, don't think of Jacques as a human being. He's from another world.
answer: And just where are you from?

question: Italy! There is nothing like music. It speaks from the heart. Can you tell me why we bother diving in the dark, the cold, without ever taking the time to breathe? Huh? Can you tell me why we do it? Why?
answer: ... For the mermaids.

question: My father used to see them everywhere too... but the only one he ever caught was my mother... Actually she caught him.
answer: Today at lunch, you asked me if I had any questions.

question: Ah ha. You finally want to know about women.
answer: Why? Are they what's most important?

question: No... It depends... Sometimes they are... What, exactly do you want to know?
answer: ... Everything.

question: Everything about what?
answer: Well... about everything.

question: ... So, between Mamma, Roberto and the sisters, we yell and scream all day long. Except with Angelica. She just cries. And then finally, we all end up kissing. Can you explain that to me? Because that's what love is all about. It's a pain in the ass but keeps us together. A large and beautiful family!
answer: Enzo... We must quit the competition.

question: Why?
answer: If we don't... I'm going to beat you.

question: Huh? Well listen to him! Do you hear that?
answer: No.

question: He looks me in the eye like some fuckin' gold fish, and says
answer: ... That's what he's here for, isn't he?

question: Listen to her! "That's what he's here for"! He's here to loose, that's what he's here for. First of all, I'm unbeatable. Second, how old are you?
answer: Two years younger than you.

question: As I said, second of all you're too skinny. You've got tiny lungs. I still don't understand how you can dive without getting sick.
answer: The size of the lungs has nothing to do with it!

question: Look at me. These aren't lungs. These are... Tanks. How long can you hold your breath?
answer: I don't know. Longer than you.

question: Take it easy...
answer: Who won?

question: Won what? The Ass Hole Award? Well, let me tell you, it's a tie! Acting like a pair of two year olds! You could have died in that damn pool!
answer: Please move slowly, you're rocking the boat.

question: Lucky I was there to save you.
answer: You jumped in?

question: Only to help the medics, I assure you.
answer: My wallet.

question: It's still here.
answer: No. I want to show you. Is it ruined?

question: Well, water isn't exactly the best thing for pictures... Not even for pictures of dolphins...
answer: Give it to me. My real family... What kind of man has such a family? I'm sick of never feeling at home anywhere.

question: I'm meditating, can't you see? Jacques does two hours of yoga before going down. I can take a five minute nap, can't I?
answer: Mr. Molinari, I'm terribly sorry but I cannot allow you to dive in such an advanced state of exhaustion.

question: What do you know about the sea? Huh? Nothing! So you just put your tubes and tin cans away. The sea is mine! I know when she is ready for me and when she isn't. And today, she is ready. Understand?
answer: You dive at your own risk. You're been warned.

question: You scared me! Just checking up on your family. I guess I was drunker than I thought and the idea of going back to my hotel in a wet dress... Well...
answer: I'm glad you stayed. Thank you.

question: I'd better get back now.
answer: You... You wouldn't want to spend the day with me? ... No?

question: No? Huh? Yes, of course!!
answer: What's the matter? Is she the new one?

question: How can you tell it's a female?
answer: ... The way she moves.

question: He's a dolphin specialist.
answer: Not the way you mean. It's going to cost you more than you think! She's not like the others. She can't stand to be away from the sea.

question: How do you know that?
answer: I don't know, I just feel it.

question: Mr. Roberto, tell your brother to be reasonable. Everyone is waiting for him upstairs. The photographers are there, the press...
answer: He can't, he's indisposed.

question: Shall we call a doctor?
answer: No, it's okay. Mamma is going to try something.

question: Jacques, the dolphin is home now. And that's where we're going. Come on! Hurry up now. Our girlfriend is freezing over there.
answer: Well, good night, then...

question: You going to sleep here, all by yourself?
answer: Yes... ... It's a comfortable place.

question: Sinister is what I'd call it...! Ours is so much cheerful! Why don't you come and stay with me... There's plenty of room in my suite.
answer: The Mamma's there too.

question: Yes, the Mamma is is there.
answer: Good night Enzo, Good night Jacques.

question: What are they for?
answer: They're paramedics. They wait at 180 feet.

question: If there was a problem, they could do something right?
answer: Of course, that's what they're for.

question: ... And those?
answer: Those are the divers who go down 300 to 330 feet. They dive with a Helium-oxygen mixture. At that depth, compressed air is too dangerous because it contains carbon dioxide.

question: What's that little air bottle on the machine?
answer: That isn't for the divers actually. It's for the balloon. It blows up and pulls the diver up like an elevator. Without it, with the pressure at the bottom, the diver would just stay pinned to the sea bed.

question: But doesn't Jacques dive without anything?
answer: Yes... It's magic.

question: Congratulations Jacques! It's wonderful! Wonderful! I'm happy for you! Here... Here...
answer: What is it?

question: Little presents, nothing much... I knew it, I just knew it! Look here! Roberto's watch! I won it! He bet that you couldn't beat me! You still collect them?
answer: Yes.

question: You don't have that one, do you?
answer: No. Thank you. It's really beautiful.

question: Jacques?
answer: What are you doing here?

question: I'm going to leave, Jacques. I'm going back home.
answer: Why?

question: Because one shouldn't fall in love with creatures from the sea.
answer: I'm not from the sea... I don't understand what you're talking about.

question: Yes you do. You know exactly what I'm talking about. You're afraid I want to hold onto you, and I do, but you're not ready... at least not for me.
answer: But it's not true, I feel good with you... It feels right...

question: I've got to get back to the hotel... and get my suitcase packed.
answer: Will... will we see each other again?

question: Take good care of yourself, Jacques.
answer: Where can I call you? Johana, tell me where can I call you? Can I come in?

question: So what!? His job is to hand out the paychecks. And he does that very well, let me tell you. You still thinking about her? Don't think about her anymore! Let me tell you, you're just making yourself unhappy! There are so many women in the world! Plenty of women everywhere right?
answer: Smoking is absolutely forbidden.

question: It isn't lit yet.
answer: You shouldn't even carry cigarettes on board!

question: Listen we're not supposed to piss either but that doesn't stop you from carrying "it" on board?!
answer: The rules are the rules.

question: ... What's your name again?
answer: Noireuter.

question: And where did you say you were from?
answer: I didn't say... Brussels!

question: ... I was seventeen, I loved her so much I tried to die for her. Two years later I couldn't even remember her name! Let me tell you, time erases everything!
answer: I don't want to erase anything.

question: You'd rather think about it and make yourself miserable?
answer: ... Yes.

question: I give you this. You're stubborn... Dumb, but stubborn.
answer: Thank you.

question: You have enough air for 15 minutes.
answer: What's with the voice?

question: It's nothing. It's just the helium, because of the air pressure.
answer: And... does the voice come back?

question: For others, yes... For you, who knows?
answer: Try speaking to me?

question: ... And if we repaint the walls, we'll need new curtains, you put the painters on you Visa and I'll do the curtains on American Express... for the couch there's Bloomingdales... or are you still over your limit?
answer: Way past it.

question: Does that have a hidden meaning?
answer: No. I'm just depressed.

question: You look it too. You haven't been working out, you haven't been taking your vitamins! You haven't been drinking your herbs, you haven't been...
answer: I know, I know! I'm a terrible person... It's... I'm so damn, damn sad.

question: What is it honey... the frenchy?
answer: Do you think I should have stayed? Don't you think maybe I should have stayed? I've been a jerk, right? I should have stayed! I was supposed to be in love... I was in love! I am in love, why did I act like a bitch? He went swimming. All the man did was go swimming! I must be crazy. It was too good to be true.

question: Well Miss Cross, herbs aren't going to do the trick this time.
answer: It's serious, right?

question: I think so. You're pregnant... Congratulations! If that's in order?
answer: It's in order! Thank you. Thank you.

question: Good afternoon.
answer: I came to make a clean breast of everything... the whole business.

question: Yes. Of course. Very wise.
answer: Remember when I went to Italy and canceled the policy on the new stadium. Well, we weren't being cheated by the Mafia or anybody except maybe by me... ... Do they come for lunch everyday? I really went on my own business, to see a man that I happen to be in love with... and I'm glad I did it, but I'm sorry about the policy and I'll be happy to make up the money the company didn't get... of course just now I don't have... One million, four hundred and ten thousand dollars. But if you were to dock my salary, say, twenty dollars a week, in a few hundred years we'd be even... and I think this is where you fire me?

question: You're right. You're fired.
answer: Will that interfere with my getting maternity leave? I'm pregnant.

question: The Italian, I presume?
answer: No. He's French, he was just in Italy for the competition.

question: He seems to have won it.
answer: Yes, isn't it wonderful? I'm so happy. I'll bet I'm the happiest pregnant fired person in the world! Bon appetit and Adieu!

question: Yes, isn't it wonderful? I'm so happy. I'll bet I'm the happiest pregnant fired person in the world! Bon appetit and Adieu!
answer: Hello?

question: It's me... Johana.
answer: How are you?

question: I got fired.
answer: ... That's funny... I had this job with Enzo... we got fired too.

question: It's getting light out.
answer: Here, it's getting dark. I've been thinking about you a lot, you know...

question: So have I. ... Hello?
answer: I'm still here.

question: Well, then, talk to me some more.
answer: ... It's hard you know. You're so far away and I don't know what else to say.

question: Then, tell me a story.
answer: Uh... Ah! A story? Do you know how it is? Do you know what you're supposed to do to meet a mermaid?

question: No... tell me.
answer: You go down to the bottom of the sea, where the water isn't even blue anymore, where the sky is only a memory... and you float there, quietly, quietly and stay there... and you decide that you will die for them... Only then do they start coming out. They come and greet you and they judge the love you have for them... If it's sincere. If it's pure... They will be with you and take you away forever. Hello?

question: It's me again. I'm being a pain, huh?
answer: ... Not at all.

question: You sure?
answer: Absolutely positive.

question: Okay. In that case... I'm at the airport in Nice.
answer: Okay... huh, I'll be right over.

question: Are you okay?
answer: ... I think I love you.

question: Why did you take me to the hotel, if you live here.
answer: You'll understand.

question: Someone in there?
answer: Don't be afraid. It's my Uncle... Louis.

question: Don't be afraid. It's my Uncle... Louis.
answer: Assassin!

question: Uncle Louis, this is my friend Johana.
answer: Did you buy the cassettes? The Wagner, the Berlioz?

question: I brought Johana to meet you.
answer: Are you crazy? I have no use for a woman! Since my accident.

question: That explains it! The best lays are from New York!
answer: Uncle Louis!

question: No, no. It's true. When I was in New York, oh boy! Before my accident, you understand?
answer: Uncle Louis! Johana is my friend. She's come to stay with me for a while.

question: Good. That way I'll see more of you... Where are you going to stay?
answer: Well... here.

question: In my apartment?
answer: It's my apartment.

question: Liar! Thief! Torturer! When you were an orphan I nursed you at my breast.
answer: Uncle Louis, we have a guest!

question: I'm going to put a lock on the telephone. Did you bring the cassettes?
answer: You think it'll be all right? You'll be comfortable here?

question: You're going to live here permanently?
answer: ... Maybe, if Jacques will let me fix up the place a little.

question: He's shy, not like Enzo.
answer: Yes. Not like Enzo.

question: I think, he's really nice... He's a funny guy... sometimes even very moving.
answer: ... I'm pregnant, Bonita!

question: Are you going to keep it?
answer: Yes.

question: Does he know?
answer: No.

question: Maybe you should talk to him about it.
answer: I can't... I just don't know how to... I was thinking of something kinda stupid last night. You know those women in the greek mythology that made love with the Gods. Take Leda for example, sleeping with Jupiter, who came to earth as a swan... Well, can you imagine Leda announcing to her swan "You're going to be a father, my little chick-a-dee"?

question: But your man isn't quite a God!
answer: Probably not, but I still don't have the nerve to tell him.

question: Well, you're going to have to tell him, sometime!
answer: And you...? Do you love Enzo?

question: Well, how was it?
answer: Enzo had a bad day.

question: And you?
answer: I didn't dive.

question: You'll try again tomorrow?
answer: I don't know... it didn't feel right. I'm going to bed. I'm tired.

question: You forgot your magazine!
answer: What?

question: I wanted to say goodbye, Johana.
answer: You're leaving?

question: Yes... Could you please give this to Enzo.
answer: Of course.

question: It's no use... Just tell him I said goodbye... And give him a kiss for me, Okay?
answer: Bonita, you shouldn't be discouraged so easily.

question: I don't have the strength to fight off la Mamma... Anyway who wants to spend their whole life waiting at the end of a pier. Did you tell him?
answer: Not yet... I'm waiting for the right moment.

question: Good huh?
answer: He really was unbelievable, 328 feet, deeper than the world record... ... And, Jacques! He held his breath for four minutes and fifty seconds!

question: Good... I guess I have tomorrow's work cut out for me as Enzo would say...
answer: You must be very careful, Jacques. At these depths, to hold your breath for over five minutes is... You'd really be pushing it. I think it's very, very dangerous.

question: Jacques...?
answer: You go back, I'll walk. I won today. I dove very deep, Tina. What's so funny? Can you dive deeper? So you understand everything? That's good... So tell me why they're all angry at me? Why is Enzo angry? I never wanted to compete with him. I never wanted to be champion of anything... All I want is to escape from them all... For just a few minutes, no people... No noise... Nothing but the sea. Do you really understand me? Huh? Are we actually having a conversation here? All right then, tell me Are you sure? It's beautiful, isn't it? What's wrong?

question: It's nothing. Just the long trip. I'm a little jet-lagged.
answer: You want to lie down for a while?

question: Okay, now we have a good five minutes to have a nice peaceful talk.
answer: What are you doing here?

question: Checking out the competition.
answer: Enzo, why do you guys do this?

question: What else is there?
answer: You know what I'm talking about. Why do you and Jacques risk your lives diving?

question: You risk your life when you cross the street.
answer: Damn it! Why won't you give me a straight answer, for once?!

question: Because you'd laugh.
answer: I won't, I swear.

question: I dive in search of God. If I go deep enough I'm going to find him. To me, the sea is a religion... That surprises you, doesn't it?
answer: A little... You think it's the same for Jacques?

question: No. Jacques is a creature of the sea. He isn't meant to live on earth, among us... You should know this, Johana.
answer: He can learn. He is learning.

question: You really think so? Did you tell him you were pregnant?
answer: How do you know that?

question: You told Bonita, but you didn't tell him, right?
answer: ... Not yet.

question: Don't.
answer: Why?

question: Because he won't understand and it will just hurt you... Jacques has been put on earth by complete mistake. And he's only waiting for one thing
answer: Five minutes and fifty seconds.

question: That idiot!
answer: Is he alright? What happened?

question: Do you ever sometimes just stop and think how sweet life can be?
answer: ... Sure.

question: ... When you dive... with that machine... What does it feel like?
answer: ... The feeling of slipping without falling... The hardest is once you are at the bottom.

question: Why?
answer: Because you have to find a good reason to come back up again... And I always have a hard time finding one.

question: Enzo? Enzo... I know you're angry at me. Enzo, it's important.
answer: I'm concentrating.

question: We can't dive anymore. They want to cancel the competition for a while. It's not safe, they say. The doctors say it isn't possible to go deeper and live. Free diving is over as a sport.
answer: You say that because you have the title!

question: No! I would never cheat you.
answer: Well that's very nice of you. You were right.

question: ... I was right about what?
answer: ... It is much better down there. It's a better place. ... Push me back in the water...

question: I can't.
answer: Jacques, take me back down... Please.

question: Jacques... Are you alright? Jacques? Are you alright? Answer me! Are you alright? You've got to tell me what happened?
answer: I saw how it has to be.

question: Jacques, you know I love you.
answer: Don't be sad... It's not because of you, it's me. It's all going on inside me! I've gotta go and see.

question: See what? There is nothing to see! It's pitch black down there! It's cold. You'll be all alone! Look at me, Jacques! I am here! I exist! Look!!! I'm real! I am not a dream! Jacques will you look at me? Please! Jacques? I'm pregnant.
answer: That's good... that's wonderful. It's wonderful for you.

question: You are the father. I lied... to keep you here. Promise me one thing.
answer: Anything.
